programme.title: Interview With a Killer: A Double Life
programme.sub-title: Interview With a Killer: A Double Life
programme.desc: A gruesome video on a stolen SD card exposes Brian Steven Smith's secret double life. David Scott confronts this soft-spoken husband, and serial killer, about his nighttime hunts for vulnerable Alaskan women.

programme.title: Interview With a Killer
programme.desc: Yaser Said breaks his silence about the night he fatally shot his teenage daughters near Dallas, Texas, the events leading up to the tragedy, and how he managed to evade capture for over a decade.

programme.title: Interview With a Killer
programme.desc: Denali Brehmer agrees to kill her best friend for a man she met online offering millions for murder, but an interview with Brehmer reveals she's far from a naive teen led astray by an outside influence.

programme.title: Interview With a Killer
programme.desc: Bo Pete Jeffrey claims no memory of the crime he's convicted for, the brutal beating and murder of his wife; four years into his life sentence, Jeffrey tells a different story that opens a new window into the mind of this convicted murderer.

programme.title: Deadly Parade Crash Trial
programme.desc: A survivor of the deadly parade crash told jurors how her co-worker was killed when a red SUV slammed into the crowd. This deadly crash left a scar on Waukesha, Wisconsin, a community of 70,000.

programme.title: Deadly Parade Crash Trial
programme.sub-title: From Domestic Disturbance To Violent Road Rage
programme.desc: Immediately after the deadly Christmas parade crash, people wondered was this a case of domestic terrorism and could multiple people be involved?

programme.title: Deadly Parade Crash Trial
programme.desc: Jurors heard the harrowing details of what survivors experienced that day when six people died and 61 were injured. Jurors listened as parents recalled how their children were injured in the deadly Christmas parade crash.

programme.title: Deadly Parade Crash Trial
programme.desc: Jurors heard how a traditional family event in their community turned tragic in seconds during the deadly Christmas parade crash. Parents testified about finding their children and rushing them to the hospital.

programme.title: Deadly Parade Crash Trial
programme.desc: Police claimed that just before the deadly parade crash, Darrell Brooks had been driving around with one hand on the wheel and another hitting his ex-girlfriend in the face.

programme.title: Deadly Parade Crash Trial
programme.desc: One of the members of the Milwaukee Dancing Grannies who marched in the parade on the day of the crash, took the stand. Four of the six people who died were in that group.

programme.title: Deadly Parade Crash Trial
programme.desc: The members of the group, the Milwaukee Dancing Grannies, were close. The group member on the stand testified that they were all like family.

programme.title: Deadly Parade Crash Trial
programme.sub-title: Darrell Brooks Rants To The Judge
programme.desc: The judge in the deadly parade crash trial shut down Darrell Brooks's cross-examination based on relevancy and hearsay. Testimony then came to a stop because of new issues that Brooks claimed he had with the judge in the deadly parade crash trial.

programme.title: Pilot Triple Murder Trial
programme.desc: Lieutenant Leonard Smith introduces to the jury, surveillance video footage of the defendant's home on the day of the three homicides; later, jurors will decide if Kit Martin is capable of pulling off these three homicides in that single afternoon.

programme.title: Pilot Triple Murder Trial
programme.desc: The jury listening to the state's case against Kit Martin turns its attention to trace evidence investigators collect and test at the crime scenes; the defendant is accused of plotting and carrying out the triple murders in one day.

programme.title: Pilot Triple Murder Trial
programme.desc: DNA testimony dominates a portion of the trial; prosecutors bring in forensic scientists who scour the two crime scenes looking for evidence.

programme.title: Pilot Triple Murder Trial
programme.desc: According to the forensic scientist who analyzed DNA and blood at the crime scene, no definitive blood evidence at both crime scenes identified Kit Martin.

programme.title: Pilot Triple Murder Trial
programme.desc: A mother and daughter living in the town where the three murders occurred tell the jurors what happened on that day; sheriff's deputy is on the stand about a cell phone belonging to Calvin Phillips, one of the three neighbors that were murdered.

programme.title: Pilot Triple Murder Trial
programme.sub-title: Autopsies Of The Two Burnt Up Victims
programme.desc: A forensic pathologist testifies for the state; Dr. Jeffrey Springer conducts the autopsies of two of the three homicide victims found in the burnt-up car; according to him, both of them died by multiple gunshot wounds to the head.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: One of John O'Keefe's closest friends takes the stand; he was with O'Keefe the night before he died; the jury receives text messages between the two guys.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: The friend who had a drink with John O'Keefe and Karen Read the night before he died recalls the events; according to prosecutors accusing Karen Read of murder, they went out with friends for drinks before heading to a house party.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: Trial testimony goes into the details of the hours before John O'Keefe was pronounced dead in a hospital; O'Keefe's close friends are on the stand: Michael and Katherine Camerano, who happened to be with him and Karen read at a bar.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: Prosecutors bring jurors back to the hours before Karen Read drops off her boyfriend, John O'Keefe, to a house party during a blizzard; on the stand, is O'Keefe's close friend who learns that he died at the hospital over a text message.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: Prosecutors continue to call in close friends of John O'Keefe and the defendant, whom all are asked to recall what they remember just before O'Keefe died.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: Karen Read's defense has more questions for the bartender who served her and John O'Keefe drinks hours before he was found outside unconscious in the snow; the defense wants to show jurors that there were no issues between the couple.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: The mystery surrounding the death of Caylee Anthony grips the nation; the only thing more shocking than the testimony is the verdict itself.
